intro: Oriastrum pallidum, commonly known as the pale globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers with a distinctive dark center, and it has palmate leaves that are typically lobed. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and sagebrush steppe. Oriastrum pallidum is adapted to arid environments and is considered a characteristic species of the Great Basin and Mojave Desert regions.
